issue.title: partially revert menu tweaks to restore old look of diablo kill indicators
issue.body:
Restores look from https://github.com/diasurgical/devilutionX/pull/5210
partial revert of https://github.com/diasurgical/devilutionX/commit/9e7d223f1995d651de19da29a8243b9ca7421f44

![image](https://github.com/diasurgical/devilutionX/assets/14297035/27ef9fb5-3ecc-4ef7-8109-10aca43ff938)
current look (getting reverted) as a reference

comment.body:
I have two suggestions.

1. Location: the icons as proposed above, except for those outside the class portrait, are left-justified such that they crowd the faces in the portrait.  I think moving the icons to the bottom-right of each portrait will look less cluttered, as heads are in the left segment of the frame weapons tend to be too-right. I have no opinion on horizontal vs vertical alignment.

![IMG_7622](https://github.com/diasurgical/devilutionX/assets/39627597/9d1e61ca-1956-4e40-94e8-2bdd5df5ded7)

2. Icon appearance: I agree with @qndel re: drawing nothing when a player hasn’t defeated Diablo, although I share @AJenbo ’s concern that the outlines make them look like radio toggles. My suggestion is to use either the blood stone inventory graphic in small (16x16? 24x24?) dimensions, or a simple pentagram. The blood stone looks enough like the soul stone to be evocative, and the pentagram is self explanatory.

issue.title: fix gargoyles being always awake in mp
issue.body:
Partial fix for https://github.com/diasurgical/devilutionX/issues/5600
It's not a perfect fix - basically changes gargoyle's perma awake behavior on subsequent visits to always sit - if player is close, gargoyle will get up anyway - checking for `MFLAG_ALLOW_SPECIAL` is pointless because I think it will be always set from initializing the monster. `activeForTick` wasn't useful either because it can be non-zero and the monster can be sitting anyway - the range at which they wake up is determined by their intelligence. A proper fix would be to rewrite everything to sync actual monster flags in MP - but that's a much bigger and more complex change and imo this fix improves current situation anyway.


After adding a check for nonzero activeForTicks, this PR is a straight improvement for current situation - gargoyles that are close will wake up anyway but this will prevent awakening them on the whole level.

comment.body:
> I have a feeling you don't understand how a proper fix would differ from what Qndel has implemented here.

From Qndel's description I thought his fix makes all Gargoyles sit and heal once all players leave the level regardless whether they are awake or not.  I assumed that the proper fix he was thinking of was to save the already awoken/active gargoyles state when leaving the level so that they are still in that state when returning to it.  I thought his fix made more sense.

commits.message:
Split up lua bindings a bit

```lua
local render = devilutionx.render

local function drawGreet ()
  render.string("Hello from " .. _VERSION, 10, 40)
end
Events.OnGameDrawComplete.Add(drawGreet)
```

pull_request.title: Split up lua bindings a bit
pull_request.body:
```lua
local render = devilutionx.render

local function drawGreet ()
  render.string("Hello from " .. _VERSION, 10, 40)
end
Events.OnGameDrawComplete.Add(drawGreet)
```

The eventual goal is to replace:

```lua
local render = devilutionx.render
```

with:

```lua
local render = require('devilutionx.render')
```

repo.name: devilutionX
repo.description: Diablo build for modern operating systems

issue.title: Original Xbox 20.1fps regardless of settings
issue.body:
### Operating System

Other (please specify)

### DevilutionX version

1.5.0 (latest release)

### Describe

Original xbox build seems to average 20fps with lots of screen tearing even in dungeons 
I've tried reducing graphics settings and everything 
Is this normal on stock ram and cpu motherboards? 

### To Reproduce

Start game
Once you load into town and start moving around you will instantly notice it

### Expected Behavior

30fps without screen tearing or 20fps with some sort of forced vsync

### Additional context

_No response_

comment.body:
You can test it in the emulator Xemu.
![image](https://github.com/diasurgical/devilutionX/assets/18044879/fe9db276-3030-41b5-8477-23fddfc0f91b)

pull_request.title: Split up lua bindings a bit
pull_request.body:
```lua
local render = devilutionx.render

local function drawGreet ()
  render.string("Hello from " .. _VERSION, 10, 40)
end
Events.OnGameDrawComplete.Add(drawGreet)
```

The eventual goal is to replace:

```lua
local render = devilutionx.render
```

with:

```lua
local devilutionx = require('devilutionx.render')
```

issue.title: Text inputs: Selection, copy, cut
issue.body:
Adds shift selection, Ctrl+C, and Ctrl+X handling.

![image](https://github.com/diasurgical/devilutionX/assets/216339/1ac95124-9c53-4da2-bdaf-cab3217cb82c)


Also fixes left-right movement for non-ASCII characters.

comment.body: Not going to disagree, but I don't even think Quake console has copy paste or selecting text... Of cause I don't think it lets you write QuakeC ingame either

issue.title: Android TV support fails d-pad verification
issue.body:
![image](https://github.com/diasurgical/devilutionX/assets/204594/0a3aa31a-22a0-4899-a8b2-9a30621e42db)

Home Screen Banner: https://developer.android.com/training/tv/start/start.html#banner
UI Patterns: https://developer.android.com/design/tv/patterns.html#banner (404)
Visual Design and User Interaction https://developer.android.com/docs/quality-guidelines/tv-app-quality#TV-LB

DPAD Control: https://developer.android.com/training/tv/start/navigation.html#d-pad-navigation
Hardware Declaration: https://developer.android.com/training/tv/start/hardware.html#declare-hardware-requirements

comment.body: Não falamos esta língua.  Entre em contato com o Google e eles lhe darão mais informações.  Seu comentário não parece estar relacionado a este projeto, portanto será removido.

commits.message:
`text_render`: Replace optional args with struct

4 options args are a bit unwieldy, especially when you want
to pass only the first and the last one.

With a struct, there is no need to specify the default values
for the args in between.

pull_request.title: `text_render`: Replace optional args with struct
pull_request.body:
4 optional args are a bit unwieldy, especially when you want to pass only the first and the last one.

With a struct, there is no need to specify the default values for the args in between.
